content.description:
Long and steep,

The Arraignment

is a thin and tricky route with few rests and hard to decipher holds. Pumpy and relentless, this is a good test of endurance and patience.

Still a bit frail, the direct line through the bolts is solid. Not too bad.
content.location:
This is the left-most route of three at the

Bridge Area

proper. It is the direct left neighbor of

New Fandango

. Find the small bridge and walk down the quick trail over a boulder to the base of the three lines.

content.description:
Since MP has (as of 14 May) the Pied Piper Wall in the wrong place, and that pin leads you to two random lines that don't look like 5.8s, but didn't (until now) show up online, let's save yourself from yourself.

Kind of a dump, with a tree up your back, rather junk climbing.
content.location: There are two lines about 100' left of the good hard climbs at the Bridge. They're only 25' off the road, but there's no trail, spider webs all over the route. There's a reason they aren't climbed, except for people who think they are getting on the Pied Piper Wall...

content.description:
This has bigger holds than

Taking the Bullet

but wanders more with the crux up top. An endurance route with great exposure.
content.protection: 10-11 bolts to mussy hooks. Use a 60 meter rope.
content.location:
Directly left of

Taking the Bullet

.

content.description: This is a classic. It has a thin start but eases up to easier climbing with some nice bulges and rests. An endurance journey for the 11a climber.
content.protection: 10 bolts to mussy hooks. Use a 60 meter rope and tie a knot on the end.
content.location: Directly across (south side) the one car camping area at the bridge. There are 2 climbs on this wall. It goes 10d and 11a, left to right. Both are stellar.

content.description: This is a thin route that starts to overhang at the top with less positive holds. Bring your footwork.
content.location: As you drive up the road its on the left side before you get to the bridge. Jump over some rocks to get to the wall. There are 3 climbs there. Left to Right: 11b, 11b, 11d. This one is the middle climb.

content.description: This is a fabulous climb. Start at the overhang and boulder to a sloper over the top, pull over and rest. The remainder is very good with cobble sidepulls and crimps. Guide says 11b. I thought it was harder.
content.location: This is the first climb on the left in this area. Just look for the overhanging bouldery start.

content.description: A nice warmup if you want to work your way across the wall.  A short route with huge holds all the way.
content.location: The far right route on the wall, just right of Crime Scene.

content.description: BB called this one of the only maple slab routes. It is nice and thin with some very different movement. A great climb.
content.location: As you drive up the road its on the left side before you get to the bridge. Jump over some rocks to get to the wall. There are 3 climb there. Left to Right: 11b, 11b, 11d. This one is the furthest right one.

content.description:
Since MP has (as of 14 May) the Pied Piper Wall in the wrong place, and that pin leads you to two random lines that don't look like 5.8s, but didn't (until now) show up online, let's save yourself from yourself.

There are so many other good climbs here, it's criminal if you waste time here .
content.location: There are two lines about 100' left of the good hard climbs at the Bridge. They're only 25' off the road, but there's no trail, spider webs all over the route. There's a reason they aren't climbed, except for people who think they are getting on the Pied Piper Wall...

content.description: Starts on jugs and sidepulls, continues with pockets, cobble jugs and a crimp or two to a good rest. After the rest, climb up to an intimidating overhang. Clip the last bolt, bear left to surmount the overhang, and arrive at the anchors.
content.location:
Look for a tall chimney upcanyon just a bit from camping area past the bridge. On the wall to the left of the chimney

Crime Scene

is the second route from the right. The route climbs over a small, dark pod.

content.description: A tricky start to more positive holds with one or two nice layback-style holds. A more technical move or two between a couple of the upper bolts, followed by more jugs to the anchors.
content.location: Look for a tall chimney upcanyon just a bit from the camping area past the bridge. On the wall to the left of the chimney this is the third route from the right.
